definition: to cut apart/to sever/to separate/to isolate
to split/to crack/to break open/to rend

sentences.english: Well, for one thing good coffee beans are never splintered or broken.
sentences.chinese: 那麼好的一件事咖啡豆從來割裂或破碎。

sentences.english: The bleed effect of " Lacerate " now increases in potency with greater attack power.
sentences.chinese: 割裂的流血效果受攻擊強度的加成。

sentences.english: One can't separate politics from economics.
sentences.chinese: 不能把政治與經濟割裂開來。

sentences.english: How do you know those things didn't rupture his peritoneum ?
sentences.chinese: 你怎麼就知道這個手術就不會割裂他的腹膜？

sentences.english: But development can not be seperated from the continuous increase of GDP.
sentences.chinese: 發展也不能同實現GDP的持續快速增長割裂開來。

sentences.english: The RNA-coding sequences of eukaryotes can be interrupted with introns.
sentences.chinese: 真核生物的基因是具有內含子的割裂基因。

sentences.english: I said ignore the finishers, so that removes Rip and FB.
sentences.chinese: 我說過忽略掉終結技，那麼移除了割裂和兇猛撕咬。

sentences.english: The two provinces are divided by long-standing tensions.
sentences.chinese: 這兩個省被長久以來的緊張局勢割裂。

sentences.english: So we can't separate his creation in terms of the different themes.
sentences.chinese: 不能基於題材分野就將之割裂開來甚至厚此薄彼。

sentences.english: Rupture is much better than eviscerate, even without the glyph.
sentences.chinese: 割裂比剔骨好，即使在沒有割裂雕紋的情況下。

sentences.english: Rupture is much better than eviscerate, even without the glyph.
sentences.chinese: 割裂比剔骨好，即使在沒有割裂雕紋的情況下。

definition: one divides into two/to be two-sided/there are two sides to everything/to see both sb's good points and shortcomings (idiom)
to cause a wound to close up and heal
to overlap/to superimpose/to telescope/to run together/to duplicate/one over another/superposition/an overlap/redundancy/reduplication (in Chinese grammar, e.g. 散散步[san4 san4 bu4] to have a stroll)
to cut off/to chop sth in half
(literary) to eliminate/to put an end to
to dismember/(fig.) to break into parts
